===Noun===
{{zh-noun}}

# [[Literary Chinese]]; literary language used from the fall of the {{w|Han dynasty}} (220 {{C.E.}}) to the early 20th century.
# [[Classical Chinese]]; literary language used in old China

====Usage notes====
Careful usage distinguishes between {{zh-l|文言}} (literary writing, used from the fall of the {{w|Han dynasty}} (220 {{C.E.}}) to the early 20th century) on the one hand, and {{m|zh|古文||Ancient Writing}} or, formally, {{m|zh|[[古典]][[漢語]]||[[Classical Chinese]]}} (Classical Chinese, used from the {{w|Zhou Dynasty}} (1045 {{B.C.E.}}) (especially the {{w|Spring and Autumn Period}}), through to the end of the {{w|Han Dynasty}} (220 {{C.E.}})) on the other. However, the terms are often conflated.
